prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: A lawyer who's been at the agency since before I joined. He has an amazing ability to spot lies through people's tells.
Character 1
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: The lawyer who owns the agency. I owe him for giving me the chance to become a full-fledged lawyer.
Character 2
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: Mr. Wright's darling daughter. She wants to be a famous magician someday.
Character 3
Name: Aristotle Means
Description: A lawyer course professor at the academy. His smile is somewhat scary.
Character 4
Name: Constance Courte
Description: The professor who invited Mr. Wright to the academy. She is a judge course teacher, but she's not very punctual.
Character 5
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: A senior in the judge course. She's a good friend, and I've known her since childhood.
Character 6
Name: Hugh O'Conner
Description: A senior in the lawyer course who served as the defense in the mock trial. He seems like kind of a jerk.
Character 7
Name: Robin Newman
Description: A senior in the prosecutor course who served as the prosecution in the mock trial. He tends to shout at people.
Character 8
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The lively detective in charge of this case. He makes you wonder what justice is really all about.
Character 9
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Character 10
Name: Klavier Gavin
Description: Mr. Rock Star Prosecutor himself, he was the leader and vocalist of the Gavinners.
Character 11
Name: Myriam Scuttlebutt
Description: A senior in the judge course. She is the aloof editor-in-chief of the school paper who walks around with a box over her head.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My brand-new, shiny badge. It shows that I'm a lawyer.
Evidence 1
Name: Arrow
Description: The arrow that pierced the victim's side. It's stained with blood.
Evidence 2
Name: Courte's Planner
Description: Constance Courte's planner. A sword emblem is printed on the cover and on each page. [info] She recorded all of her plans in great detail. One page reads, "23rd - Meet with Hugh" and "Important."
Evidence 3
Name: Themis Herald
Description: A school paper with a malicious scoop on an alleged love triangle involving Junie.
Evidence 4
Name: Stage Costume
Description: A costume Junie was supposed to wear. It has a glowing star pattern. (With notes, 2 pages.)
Evidence 5
Name: Mock Trial Script
Description: A top secret script written by Junie. There's only one copy. (4 pages.)
Evidence 6
Name: Themis Herald Extra
Description: An extra edition of the school paper that covers the mock trial.
Evidence 7
Name: Awl
Description: The weapon used to murder Constance Courte. Her blood was found on it along with Junie's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Courte's Autopsy Report
Description: Est. time of death: Between 6 and 8 PM. Cause of death: Blood loss from a deep stab wound in the victim's side.
Evidence 9
Name: Tape Recorder
Description: Used by Myriam to secretly record the conversation in the art room. A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!" A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!" Recorded in the art room at 7:10 PM on the 23rd. The voice on the tape says "You're a goner!" just like in Junie's script. It may be a fake. The voice on the tape says "You're a goner!" just like in Junie's script. It's been identified as a fake. Identified as a fake. Prof. Means used Hugh to pass it on to the police.
Evidence 10
Name: Glowing Costume Photo
Description: A photo of the stage costume taken in a dark room. A coat of fluorescent paint made it glow.
Evidence 11
Name: School Camera Photo
Description: A photo of the art room while preparations were being made. Taken on the day of the murder.
Evidence 12
Name: School Banner
Description: A large banner that was hung by a wire between the stage and art room. A trace amount of blood was found on it.
Evidence 13
Name: Purple Fragment → Purple Fragments
Description: A purple fragment from a broken statue. It was found all alone in the strangest of places. Two purple fragments of a broken statue. Going to search for more. Three purple fragments of a broken statue that originally stood on a pedestal onstage.
Evidence 14
Name: White Fragment → White Fragments
Description: A large, white fragment. It has a distinctive shape that could be described as angular. Two large, white fragments. It looks like it would feel good to break them.
Evidence 15
Name: Lady Justice
Description: This and the statue of Klavier were broken at the same time, but have been repaired. No one knows where it came from. It was found broken onstage. Professor Courte had remade it into a completely different-looking statue the day before the mock trial.
Evidence 16
Name: "Hugh" Scrap
Description: Discovered onstage, it appears to be a piece of paper torn from a notebook. The name "Hugh" is written on it.
Evidence 17
Name: Burnt Fragments
Description: The burnt remnants of the Gavinners banner that was tossed into the incinerator and later found by Myriam.
Evidence 18
Name: Stage Set Up Photos
Description: The last two of Myriam's photos. They show the students setting up the stage's backdrop on the night of the murder. (2 photos.)
Evidence 19
Name: Voiceprint Analysis
Description: The results of the voice analysis performed on the tape recording.
Evidence 20
Name: Lecture Hall Diagram
Description: A diagram of the lecture hall where the mock trial took place.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I snuck into Juniper's dressing room while everyone was in the Lecture Hall.
Person: Scuttlebutt
Testimony 1
Testimony: Juniper had changed into her stage costume. I asked her, "What're you doing?"
Person: Scuttlebutt
Testimony 2
Testimony: When suddenly, she fled into the hallway, as if she wanted me to follow her.
Person: Scuttlebutt
Testimony 3
Testimony: I followed her all the way to Prof. Courte's body! She led me right to it!
Person: Scuttlebutt
Testimony 4
Testimony: I'm positive it was Juniper because she was wearing the costume that she had made! [caption] The photo shows the back of a figure in a plain blue costume.
Person: Scuttlebutt

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let's start by understanding the scenario.

We have a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies related to a murder case. The goal is to identify one evidence and one testimony that contradict each other. 

First, I'll go through the characters to get a sense of who's involved. The main characters include Apollo Justice, Phoenix Wright, Trucy Wright, Aristotle Means, Constance Courte, Juniper Woods, Hugh O'Conner, Robin Newman, Bobby Fulbright, Simon Blackquill, Klavier Gavin, and Myriam Scuttlebutt. 

Next, I'll look at the evidences. There are 21 pieces of evidence, ranging from an Attorney's Badge to a Lecture Hall Diagram. Each evidence has a description that provides context about its relevance to the case. For example, Evidence 1 is an arrow that pierced the victim's side, and Evidence 7 is an awl with the victim's blood and Juniper's fingerprints.

Now, I'll examine the testimonies. There are five testimonies from Myriam Scuttlebutt. She claims she followed Juniper to the crime scene, implying Juniper's involvement. Specifically, she mentions that Juniper was wearing a stage costume when she fled.

Looking for contradictions, I need to find an evidence that directly conflicts with one of these testimonies. Let's focus on the stage costume. Evidence 4 describes the stage costume Juniper was supposed to wear, which has a glowing star pattern. However, in Testimony 4, Myriam describes the costume as plain blue, which doesn't match the glowing star pattern described in the evidence.

This discrepancy suggests that Myriam's testimony about the costume might be unreliable or fabricated. If the costume had a glowing star pattern, it would be noticeable, and Myriam's description of it being plain blue contradicts the evidence.

Therefore, Evidence 4 and Testimony 4 contradict each other because the costume's description in the evidence doesn't match Myriam's testimony.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm presented with a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies related to a legal case, and I need to identify a pair that contradicts each other. The user has provided a specific format for the answer, which is a JSON object with two keys: "evidence" and "testimony," each pointing to their respective indices.

First, I'll review the characters involved to understand the context better. The main characters include Apollo Justice, Phoenix Wright, and several others connected to the case, such as professors, students, and detectives. The case revolves around a murder at an academy, with various pieces of evidence and testimonies provided.

Next, I'll examine the evidences listed. Each evidence has a description, and some have additional details in brackets. For example, Evidence 1 is an arrow stained with blood, and Evidence 2 is a planner belonging to Professor Courte with a sword emblem. The key here is to look for any evidence that directly conflicts with a testimony.

Now, I'll look at the testimonies. Testimony 0 through Testimony 6 are from Hugh O'Conner, a senior in the lawyer course. He describes his activities on the day of the mock trial, mentioning meditation at the archery range until 7:00 PM, seeing Juniper around 7:15 PM, and not entering the art room. He also mentions hearing the final bell ten to fifteen minutes earlier than usual.

The task is to find a contradiction between any evidence and testimony. Let's consider each evidence and see if it conflicts with any testimony.

Starting with Evidence 2: Courte's Planner. It mentions a meeting with Hugh on the 23rd, which is the day of the mock trial. This could imply that Hugh was supposed to meet with Professor Courte, but in his testimony, he doesn't mention such a meeting. This could be a point of contradiction if the meeting was significant and he failed to disclose it.

Looking at Testimony 0, Hugh says he meditated at the archery range until 7:00 PM. If the planner indicates a meeting around that time, it could contradict his testimony of meditating alone.

Another point is Evidence 7: the Awl, which is the murder weapon with Juniper's fingerprints. However, in Testimony 4, Hugh mentions seeing Juniper wearing her stage costume, which might not directly contradict but could hint at her presence near the crime scene.

Focusing back on Evidence 2 and Testimony 0, the planner shows a meeting with Hugh, which he doesn't mention in his testimony. This omission could be significant, indicating that Hugh might be hiding information or that the meeting took place, contradicting his claim of meditating alone.

Therefore, the contradiction lies between Evidence 2 (Courte's Planner) and Testimony 0 (Hugh's statement about meditating alone without mentioning the meeting).
</think>
